style.name: Session India Pale Ale
style.description: Session India Pale Ales are gold to copper. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures and hop haze is allowable at any temperature. Fruity-ester aroma is light to moderate. Hop aroma is medium to high with qualities from a wide variety of hops from all over the world. Low to medium maltiness is present. Hop flavor is strong, characterized by flavors from a wide variety of hops. Hop bitterness is medium to high. Fruity-ester flavors are low to moderate. Diacetyl is absent or at very low levels. Body is low to medium.

data.name: Small Beer No. 9
data.description:
An exceptionally satisfying and full bodied beer for its stature, with the same big hop hit you may have come to expect from our more muscular Pale Ales. This beer is vibrant with citrus, melon and sherbet flavours meandering to gentle bitter finish.

Malts: Pale, Munich, CaraGold, Crystal, (Barley) Wheat, Oats. 

Hops: Target, Bramling Cross, Hull Melon, Columbus.

Yeast:Safale US-05.

breweries.name: Hop Farm Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Hop Farm Brewing Company is dedicated to the responsible use of our natural resources, from production to packaging and everywhere in between. We grow our own hops, by hand, organically and add them to every batch we brew. 

The inspiration for Hop Farm Brewing Company began over a decade ago. A green thumb naturally led to growing some of our own hops. The passions of growing hops and making beer came together when Hop Farm Brewing Company opened its doors in September of 2013 at 5601 Butler Street in Pittsburgh's Lawrenceville neighborhood. 

The tap list is ever changing and growing based on seasons so stop by soon and see what beers our staff have crafted for you!

breweries.name: New Belgium Brewing
breweries.description: We'll set the scene: 1989. Belgium. Boy on bike. (OK, make that a young man of 32). As our aspiring young homebrewer rides his mountain bike with fat tires through European villages famous for beer, New Belgium Brewing Company was but a glimmer in his eye. Or basement. For Jeff Lebesch would return to Fort Collins with a handful of ingredients and an imagination full of recipes. And then there was beer. Jeff's first two basement-brewed creations? A brown dubbel with earthy undertones named Abbey and a remarkably well-balanced amber he named Fat Tire. To say the rest was history would be to overlook his wife's involvement. Kim Jordan was New Belgium's first bottler, sales rep, distributor, marketer and financial planner. And now, she's our CEO.

breweries.name: Fat Head's Brewery
breweries.description: Fat Head's was founded in 1992 as a premiere craft beer tap house and restaurant in Pittsburgh, PA. In 2009 we expanded to Ohio and teamed up with our award-winning Head Brewmaster. With the explosion in popularity came the necessity to open a full-scale production brewery in 2012. Fat Head's Brewery produces original ales and lagers for distribution throughout Ohio and Western Pennsylvania.

breweries.name: Southern Barrel Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
At Southern Barrel Brewing Company, we’re combining the beauty of old with a taste of the new. The brewery was recently built in Bluffton, SC but it’s been a long time coming. We are proud to brew delicious craft beers there 24 hours a day 7 days a week. Our bar, beer garden and Tavern restaurant offer a seasonal menu featuring locally sourced ingredients and beer fresh from our brewery. We have year-round staples on tap as well as seasonal selections and limited runs. Also be sure to look for our specialty beers in the coming months brewed in whiskey, wine, tequila and rum barrels to bring you a unique kind of beer. Our indoor and outdoor seating was created to suit any mood, whether it’s dinner with the family or relaxing in the beer garden with friends.

At Southern Barrel Brewing Company you can relax, grab a bite and a brew and just…enjoy.

data.name: Splice Session IPA
data.description: Inspired by our small-batch pilot system, the Roots Release series honors our experimental brewing roots and invites you to sample some of our favorites. This full-flavored Session IPA splices together tropical fruit aromas with bold, fresh citrusy hops. The result is an easy drinking, balanced IPA; one you’ll reach for again and again.

breweries.name: Odell Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We love beer. We talk about beer. We dream about beer. And we make incredible beer. We don't mess around with serving food, making music or cutting up limes to mask our beer's flavor. Our dreams lead us to create imaginative, big, bold and beautiful beers. Every ounce of our passion is poured directly into the next bottle you open. Our mission is simple; to make consistently great beer.

Handcrafted classics and small batch experimental beers that include Pale Ales, Stouts, Pilsners and Porters. Come visit us in our tap room for a taste of how we keep the craft in craft beer.

data.name: Spring Fever Session IPA
data.description:
Can’t wait for Spring to get here? Crack open a Spring Fever Session Ale and before you know it, those winter frowns will be turned upside down!
Spring Fever delivers the flavor and impact of an American IPA with the session-ability of a light beer. Catch the fever before it’s gone!

breweries.name: Lawson's Finest Liquids
breweries.description: Lawson’s Finest Liquids, LLC is based in Warren, Vermont and distributes small, custom batches of unique beer through their exclusive wholesale distributor, The Beer Guy, LLC. Sean Lawson, founder and brewer, has been an avid home brewer for nearly twenty years, with numerous award winning recipes. Lawson’s Finest, with a small batch system, can custom craft specialty beers for establishments and events. Limited in availability by design, these rare beers can only be found near the Mad River Valley of Vermont.

breweries.name: Great Adirondack Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In 1996 the Kane family started the Lake City Brewing Company at the Great Adirondack Steak & Seafood Restaurant in Plattsburgh, NY. In 1997 the brewery was moved to our main restaurant in Lake Placid and the Great Adirondack Brewing Company was born. Our 7 barrel stainless-steel brew system was custom manufactured for us by JV Northwest, Inc. in Oregon and is now housed in a separate building directly behind the restaurant.
 
Our seven barrel stainless steel brewhouse produces a wide range of ales and lagers year round using the finest imported and domestic ingredients available. Our commitment to quality, consistency, and continued brewing knowledge has garnered us several awards through the years and is evident in the final product—the fresh pint poured off our taps.
 
We are currently producing 800 barrels a year. We pride ourselves on creating small batches of hand crafted ales and lagers covering a variety of beer styles. Our wide range of styles and ever-changing lineup of beers allows us to have something to please every palate.  Come to Lake Placid and give us a try, you won’t be sorry!

breweries.name: Three Weavers Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We created Three Weavers with one goal in mind: create a community through beer.  We believe in spending time with family and friends.  We craft beers that promote such gatherings.  The seasonality and variety of our products give reason to frequently gather, share and to become a community.

We are a craft brewery based in Inglewood, California.  Founded in 2013, we are deeply rooted in the concept of responsibility - to our environment, to our industry, to our community, and to our employees. Three Weavers exists to share our love and appreciation of beer with the world.

data.name: Steady Rollin' Session IPA
data.description: Steady Rollin' Session IPA is inspired by the lush, vibrant landscape of the Great Lakes region, our all-hours, year-round outdoor playground. Steady Rollin's tropical fruit flavors, balance, and light body make it a perfect companion for cutting a new trail or rowing to a secluded bank with friends to kick back and watch the afternoon fade away. Steady Rollin' is brewed for those days when you can only guess what time it is based on where the sun sits in the sky.

breweries.name: Great Lakes Brewing Company
breweries.description: In the 1870s, Cleveland had 30 breweries. By the early 1980s, the last one had shuttered its doors. So when brothers Patrick and Daniel Conway opened Great Lakes Brewing Company on September 6, 1988, it not only signaled a new era in Cleveland brewing, it was also the first microbrewery in the state of Ohio. And the idea of a craft brewery in Cleveland caught on fast, as curious patrons hurried in for a pint crafted in the styles of old and drawn from the taps of the beautiful Victorian era bar. The company's commitment to sustainable business practices greatly contributed to its early popularity and success. Before long, Great Lakes Brewing Company had become one of Cleveland's most popular destinations for both dining and a fun night out.

data.name: Suicide Squeeze IPA
data.description:
Out of the 90’s Pacific Northwest music scene, Suicide Squeeze Records founder David Dickenson forged his own path with acts like Modest Mouse, Elliott Smith, and Pedro the Lion, forgoing standard industry protocal. Similarly, Fort George has chosen to craft beer that is often outside the beer style guidelines. This year’s spring collaboration with Suicide Squeeze Records is one of those beers – a crisp session IPA with every bit of the hoppy flavor and aroma you’ve come to expect from Fort George. Floral and citrusy, Suicide Squeeze IPA is a light ode to spring.

VISIT SUICIDESQUEEZE.NET/FORTGEORGE TO DOWNLOAD A FREE MUSIC SAMPLER

breweries.name: Fort George Brewery
breweries.description: The Fort George Brewery + Public House was the original settlement site of Astoria founded in March 1811 by Captain Jonathan Thorn. In its heyday, Astoria was the Pacific Fur Company's primary fur trading post in the Northwest. Under temporary British authority it was renamed Fort George after King George the 3rd. In 1924 the Fort George Building was erected to house an automotive repair facility until the late 1990's. Briefly abandoned and sadly neglected, the Fort George building has been recently revitalized as a home to the Blue Schorcher Bakery and our brewpub. We are honored to play a part in the Fort and Astoria's renaissance.

breweries.name: Levante Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Levante started as many home brewing dreams start; the mission to create the perfect beer in a three gallon pot in the kitchen of a small apartment. Eric and Tim quickly realized that this is an excercise in futility, but along the way, their steadfast persistence and the quest to make a truly satisfying beer has resulted in countless hours of research and experimentation. While the small 5 gallon batches allowed for plenty of great experience, they yearned for more creative control.

The brewers decided it was time for a more professional three vessel system, giving them complete control over the brewing process. The 1/2 barrel system gave the brewers a solid platform to refine and perfect a lineup of beers for the most discerning pallet. This led to the creation of several great recipes, and a roster of clean crisp beers. The original hobby transformed into a passion for sharing world-class hand crafted beers with those who would appreciate them. 

Levante Brewing currently brews on our 15 bbl production brewery system located in West Chester, PA. We are servicing several local restaurants, pubs and distributers. Levante aims to deliver a variety of creative brews to beer lovers in Philadelphia's western suburbs and beyond.

data.name: Sundial Session IPA
data.description: Sundial, a sessionable IPA at only 4.5% ABV, is Community Beer Co.’s newest seasonal release.  When you want hops and a refreshing, crisp beer that’s drinkable all day long, Sundial is the answer.  We keep the grist simple to showcase our delicious hops, and use copious amounts of Centennial, Simcoe and Amarillo hops to give a delightful hoppy aroma and flavor.  Hop bitterness is present, but dialed back with just enough to balance the malt and contribute to the refreshing nature of our new favorite summer beer!

breweries.name: Community Beer Company
breweries.description:
BEER FOR THE GREATER GOOD.....

Community Beer Company represents many meanings --
all centered on what we feel a great Community represents.

FIRST: Beer is Communal. For ages, it’s been a central part of get-togethers among friends, family, and co-workers to celebrate old acquaintances ... or make new ones. 

SECOND: As a brewery, we are passionate about providing quality craft beer to the people within our Community: Dallas, Texas and the surrounding Metroplex. 

THIRD: We want to be stewards of our Community by adhering to environmentally sustainable business practices, production, and distribution. 

And FINALLY: We plan to become an integral part of our Community by giving back to it through charitable activities and supporting our local artists. 

Truly, Beer for the Greater Good!

data.name: Sunshine Daydream Session Ale
data.description: Our hoppy, refreshing session drinker. This bright golden colored brew offers aromas of tropical fruit and pine, along with juicy, citrusy blast on your palate. Finishes with a lingering dry bitterness. Peace, Love & Hoppiness!

data.description:
Super Session is designed to be a light and refreshing beer with low alcohol, yet the full hop character of a Session IPA. Go ahead, you can have more than one… Cheers!

breweries.name: D9 Brewing Company
breweries.description: A craft microbrewery with the purpose of brewing and sharing outstanding beer that unites people. First envisioned in July 2009 over a pot of boiling wort, our founders believed every person – and beer – has a story and decided to start a brewery where both could be shared. At the D9 Brewing Company, we seek to inspire the community and promote the art of Craft Beer.

data.name: Tail Lights
data.description: A hazy summer session IPA with a refreshing citrus hop flavor made for easy drinking on warm summer days. At 4.8% ABV, you can have a couple and still get the lawn mowed.

breweries.name: Societe Brewing Company
breweries.description: Societe Brewing Company is a production brewery founded in San Diego, California by fellow professional brewers Travis Smith and Douglas Constantiner.  In 2012, Societe Brewing Company began production and opened its doors to a warm welcome from the San Diego craft beer community.  The brewery and tasting room occupy a 16,000 square foot facility in Kerney Mesa, in the eastern part of San Diego.  Societe Brewing Company focuses on hoppy Out West ales, Belgian-inspired Old World ales, and dark and flavorful Stygian ales.  The brewery also features a 3,000 square foot barrel room, and there are intentions to release a line-up of barrel-aged sour beers in the future.  Societe’s beers are available locally throughout San Diego, and also available at the tasting room.

data.name: The Fluffer
data.description: The little brother to our flagship DRIPA, this lower-alcohol, sessionable IPA features the same bright citrus intensity in the aroma with a lighter mouthfeel and a classic dry finish. If you like big hoppy flavors, but want to last all day, you need The Fluffer. “Can't get enough of that wonderful Fluff!”

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

data.name: The Imposter
data.description: A sessionable India Pale Ale brewed with unmalted rye; the spicy malt bill supports an array of intense hop aromatics, all engendered by a classic Pacific Northwest hop bill; brewed with Cascade, Simcoe & Amarillo hops, then heavily dry-hopped with Simcoe & Amarillo.

breweries.name: Cedar Creek Brewery
breweries.description: Cedar Creek Brewery started as an idea in October 2010 and has become a reality in 2012. Session beers are our passion and we really want that to be the focus of the brewery. Don’t get us wrong we really love those huge hop and malt bombs and will be releasing them as part of our seasonal and specialty lineup but having a few while enjoying the company of friends is the way we love to drink beer. So keeping our beers drinkable and with enough creativity that you want to keep coming back for more is our goal.

data.name: Trail Magic Session IPA
data.description: The heat is on. You just finished a long run in the sun. Or, you're sitting on your porch in the cool of the evening seeking respite from summer. Or, you're celebrating the Fourth with family and friends and you desire a smooth, cold, flavorful beverage that won't put you flat on your back (not yet, anyway). Enter Outer Light Brewing Company's Trail Magic IPA. Light and crisp, it tickles the tongue with flavors reminiscent of black tea, melon, and fruit. Sessionable and refreshing, this easy-drinking ale will satisfy your summer cravings. Don't get caught trailing behind. Try our latest magical offering.

data.name: Treerider IPA
data.description: This brew climbs the branches of your palate to a floral hop bouquet of citrus flavor and aroma. Golden Promise Pale malts mingle with three hop varietals: earthly yet fruity bitterness of Simcoe, Mosaic's herbal grab bag of flavor, and the tropical aromas of Equinox.

breweries.name: Odd Side Ales
breweries.description: ​Welcome to Odd Side Ales, one of the fastest growing breweries in Michigan. Born in an old piano factory in downtown Grand Haven, Michigan, Odd Side Ales first opened its doors in March 2010. We've grown steadily since that first brew, but have never lost sight of our initial goal: to create a variety of complex beers, each with its own unique flavor. To that end, we strive to craft unusual beers that will make your taste buds dance. Whether you're looking for the perfect IPA or something ... just a little different, we've got the beer for you.

breweries.name: Acoustic Ales Brewing Experiment
breweries.description:
Acoustic Ales Brewing Experiment is located in the historic Mission Brewery Plaza along the I-5, just north of downtown San Diego and just a hop away from the San Diego airport.

The original brewery housed in this building was shut down during Prohibition. The Old Brewery has now been expertly reconditioned and is up and running with a 
15-barrel brewing capacity, not to mention producing some exceptional beers.

data.name: Unicorn IPA
data.description: Our take on an ever-evolving classic. Good deep malt undercurrent is shaken by a slowly surging citrus wave. Lemon and sherbet notes fade to leave a refreshing, lingering bitterness.

breweries.name: Moor Beer Company
breweries.description:
Moor Beer Company brings you something different – a company dedicated to quality products, service to the community and social responsibility. We are not publicly traded and leave our accountability to the people that matter – our customers, employees, suppliers and families.

We strive to produce strongly flavoured beers of exceptional character. All our beers are brewed using only natural ingredients. We put a lot into our beers by using the finest malt, hops, yeast and water – but don’t take anything out. All our beers are unfiltered so they retain the yeast that is so vital to producing exceptional flavour, as well as providing vitamins.

data.name: Us & Them IPA - Unchained 21
data.description: Brewer Gabe Smoley’s Unchained 21: Us & Them is a truly unique craft beer exploration. Gabe has deconstructed the mash of Summit's popular Sága IPA recipe into two unique “threads” to forge two distinct beers: a hoppy and intense American IPA and a complex, but subtle Session IPA. This unique brewing experience explores the two extreme flavor profiles and drinking differences you can discover in one package from one, original beer recipe. Which beer do you think is “Us” and which beer is “Them”? Which brew defines you? Offered in 6 packs that include three bottles of each brew. Also available on draught.

breweries.name: Summit Brewing Company
breweries.description: Summit Brewing Company is a regional craft brewery in St. Paul, Minnesota that brews a wide selection of popular beers. It is sometimes mistakenly believed to be a microbrewery, even though Summit's output is in the top 50 of breweries in the United States, approximately 80,000 barrels of beer per year. Their flagship beer, an American pale ale (branded Summit Extra Pale Ale) is especially popular in the Twin Cities area.

breweries.name: Tired Hands Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We value local over imported, small batches over mass production, and striking a successful balance between giving back to our community and personal profit. Localization guides everything we do, from sourcing raw ingredients and materials, to employing area talent.

Tired Hands Brewing Company will operate at 16 Ardmore Avenue, Ardmore Pa, on a six barrel brewhouse. We will focus our brewing on two very broad styles of beers that hold a special place in my heart: Belgian/French farmhouse ales and American hop-forward ales.

All cheeses, meats, and seasonal produce served at our cafe (simple and satisfying fare from honest local producers) will be sourced from within 100 miles of our brewery.

breweries.name: Hill Farmstead Brewery
breweries.description: Hill Farmstead Brewery is the culmination of travel and insight, of friendships and explorations, and of realizing a sense of one’s place.  Upon the hand hewn land of our forebears, we honor eight generations of Greensboro ancestry by thoughtfully engaging with our heritage and with our distinctive beers. This offering is our effort to revive, diversify, and prolong the memory of the Hill Farmstead. Share. Consider. Enjoy.

data.name: Ways & Means
data.description: Ways & Means is a session IPA brewed with rye and just the right amount of Citra and Centennial hops for pleasing bitterness. It boasts complex aromatics of citrus and tropical fruits, finishing with the typical clean, refreshing character for which our beers are known. The very first keg of this beer was served in the United States Capitol to members of the U.S. Congress Ways & Means committee. Both Democrats and Republicans found that it was a beer that all could agree upon.

breweries.name: Port City Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The historic port city of Alexandria, VA has a proud tradition of brewing beer for the region that dates back to the 19th century. 

Port City Brewing Company is proud to revive, celebrate and continue this rich brewing history in our modern artisanal brewery right outside of our Nation’s Capital.  

Named Small Brewery of the Year at the 2015 Great American Beer Festival, we proudly brew world class quality beers for the DC and Mid Atlantic market..
Our mission is to be a reliable and innovative regional brewer of top quality beers that are delicious and well balanced, made from the finest ingredients available, and which celebrate their raw materials.

data.name: What I'm Having
data.description: All the juicy hop flavor you crave with less of the intoxicating qualities of it’s big brother.  What I’m Having is generously dry hopped with Amarillo and Citra for a citrusy, tropical hop flavor.

data.name: Whetstoner
data.description: Our flagship beer, this bright and delicious session IPA has an ABV of 4.3% and showcases the flavors and aromas of Simcoe, Amarillo, and Citra hops. The hop additions for this beer all occur post-boil--in the whirlpool, hopback, and fermentor--giving this beer a big, dank aroma but preserving its light body. The grain bill is simple: the majority being floor-malted two-row pale malt with a touch of dextrin malt and crystal malt (30° L).

breweries.name: Hinterland Brewery
breweries.description: Hinterland is a small artisinal brewery devoted to brewing world class beer. Founded in 1995, by Bill & Michelle Tressler, Hinterland makes it's home in a turn of the century meat packing warehouse. Our award-winning beer can be found throughout Wisconsin's finest restaurants, taverns, grocery stores or anywhere craft beer is sold.In addition, Hinterland beer is served at our restaurant attached to the brewery in Green Bay as well as Hinterland Erie Street Gastropub in Milwaukee's Third Ward District and at our affiliated restaurant The Whistling Swan Inn & Restaurant in Fish Creek, WI.

data.name: White IPA
data.description: Not your traditional IPA, this is a wheat based beer fermented with a hefeweizen yeast giving it a hazy gold appearance with a Belgian feel. Plenty of hops are added early in the boil to give it that IPA bitterness, while the Citra and Amarillo hops add a fruity, citrus aroma.

breweries.name: Golden Road Brewing
breweries.description: Golden Road is a brewery located in Los Angeles, California.  Founders Tony Yanow and Meg Gill share a vision to bring fresh beer to locals, bolstering the greater LA craft community.  Located off of the 5 freeway, north of downtown, our pub is open daily, offering great food and a wide variety of our latest brews.

locations.name: Pub
locations.hoursOfOperation: Monday - Sunday: 11AM-11PM
